Text: The American Coal Company Million Debt PrepaymentToday The American Coal Company paid Enron million in principal and interest which included a prepayment of the remaining million balance on its debt with Enron million Senior Note million Subordinated Note These two notes with maturities of July and July respectively were established in July to provide financing for the acquisition of the Galatia Mine by Bob Murray Despite the termination of the credit relationship the physical relationship remains in place through December with projected deliveries of tons of Galatia coal and tons of Maple Creek Coal The value in the remaining coal supported by puts and fixed price arrangements is in excess of million Beyond the value in the transaction this deal along with the DPR transaction with Cline in provided the foundation for Enrons coal business With this prepayment Enron has now received over million from its coal investments The breakdown of the funding and cash flow is shown below Approved Commitments million Funded Commitments million Enron Funding Net of Calpers million Enron Cash Flows Principal million Interest million Equity Distributions million Marketing Fees million Margin on Physical Coal million Total million In addition to the cash flow received to date the investments are projected to provide minimum future cash flows as follows Principal and interest million Loans secured by assets Marketing fees million Minimum marketing fees Coal commodity margin million Value of American Coal physical transaction Equity distributions interest in Dakota Remington interest in BMR Total million equity distributions
